channel.title: Newbie problem: Getting the client to work
channel.description:
Hi there, im using Deathlypvpz v3 by hack3r. Im quite new to this so forgive me if im asking something stupid, but i can't seem to get the client to work. This is the error:
[img]http://i45.tinypic.com/28akj89.png[/img]
I've changed the paths of the files to the right location, and turning on the source works fine. However, i keep getting this error when trying to execute the client.
I've went into the client.java to change all the ip's to 'localhost' etc, didnt work.
I looked at where the error seemed to be, and i ended up at lines that look like this one: [code] signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost());[/code]
I don't understand what this does, nor how i fix it.
Could anyone possibly help me with this?

item.title: Newbie problem: Getting the client to work
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

godog:

in your client right click hit edit if you see (x86) delete it. if u so something with jdk something tell me

Why would he do that? It’s clearly not the issue.

UnknownHostException =

Thrown to indicate that the IP address of a host could not be determined.
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/net/UnknownHostException.html

You know when you were putting in the relevant IPs, did you type in 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1 (or is it 127.0.1, I used to type 0.0.0.0 so I’ve forgotten sorry lol).

  • You seem like a nice guy based on your post, I just felt like letting you know :p.

Read full topic
item.source: Newbie problem: Getting the client to work

@godog wrote:

make sure the jdk is the same as your if you have jdk

item.title: Newbie problem: Getting the client to work
item.dc:creator: @Just_a_newbie Just a newbie
item.description:
@Just_a_newbie wrote:

godog:

in your client right click hit edit if you see (x86) delete it. if u so something with jdk something tell me

First of all thanks for the reply.

No there is no x86 in the client file
This is the client content: @echo off title Client cd ./locandclass/ "C:/Program Files/Java/jdk1.7.0_11/bin/java" -Xmx512m client 10 0 highmem members 64 pause

Read full topic
